# Social Data Analytics (SoDA)

## What is it?

## {background-iframe="https://soda.la.psu.edu"}

## Requirements

- [SODA 501](https://bulletins.psu.edu/search/?P=SODA%20501) (3 credits), [SODA 502](https://bulletins.psu.edu/search/?P=SODA%20502) (3 credits)
- 12 or more elective credits
  - Core analytics distribution (3+ credits)
  - Quantification distribution (6+ credits)
  - Computational/informational distribution (6+ credits)
  - Social distribution (6+ credits)

<https://bulletins.psu.edu/graduate/programs/majors/social-data-analytics/#degreerequirementstext>

## More...

>**the typical SoDA student will need to take four 3-credit courses outside of their home department**: two core SoDA seminars and two electives that satisfy requirements not satisfied in their home department.

>**the typical SoDA student will not have to alter their committee.**

<https://soda.la.psu.edu/programs/graduate-program/requirements/>

## Applying

>Applicants interested in the dual-title degree program may make their interest in the program known on their applications to the primary graduate program and include remarks in their statement of purpose that address the ways in which their research and professional goals in their chosen primary field reflect an expanded interest in Social Data Analytics.

<https://bulletins.psu.edu/graduate/programs/majors/social-data-analytics/#admissionrequirementstext>

---

>...a student must submit a letter of application and transcript, which will be reviewed by the Social Data Analytics Admissions Committee. An applicant must have a minimum grade point average of 3.0 (on a 4-point scale) to be considered for enrollment in the dual-title degree program. 

<https://bulletins.psu.edu/graduate/programs/majors/social-data-analytics/#admissionrequirementstext>

---

>Students must be admitted into the dual-title degree program in Social Data Analytics **no later than the end of the fourth semester** (not counting summer semesters) of entry into the primary Ph.D. program and before taking the comprehensive exam.

<https://bulletins.psu.edu/graduate/programs/majors/social-data-analytics/#admissionrequirementstext>
